Basic operation
You can configure each app if it should be able to see root (green icon), if root should be hidden from it (red icon), or if the app should be hidden from other apps (blue icon).

For performance reasons it is best to allow apps to have root (green icon) by default.

Killing apps
Hiding root from an app only goes into effect the next time the app is started. This user interface does not kill apps automatically when you select them, because it is a slow operation. The cross icon in the app\'s toolbar allows you to manually kill all running instances of apps that root should be hidden from, once you are done configuring.

Hiding apps
Some apps (such as games) detect the presence of other apps (such as SuperSU). By pressing volume up, volume down, volume up, volume down, volume up, volume down (so three times alternated volume up, volume down) in less than 3 seconds, the selected apps will be hidden or unhidden from all other apps (including the launcher). In this hidden state, SuperSU will keep granting root to already configured apps, and will deny root from all other apps.
